intro: Alistilus, commonly known as the white hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its showy, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plants typically have palmately divided leaves and are native to temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. Alistilus species are often found in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to their toxicity, they are not recommended for cultivation in home gardens.
